The video: s title and description: The expert noted that the video's title and description claimed to show a 6.4 magnitude earthquake in Shanghai in January 2021, which raised suspicions about its authenticity.
Lack of earthquake reports: The expert conducted a keyword search on Google and found no reports or news articles about an earthquake in Shanghai in January 2021. This lack of information suggested that the claim might not be true.
Earthquake tracking websites: The expert checked various earthquake tracking websites and found no significant earthquakes recorded in Shanghai during that month. This further supported the conclusion that the claim was false.
Official earthquake records: The expert searched the website of the China Earthquake Administration and found no record of any earthquake reported in Shanghai in January 2021. The absence of official records added credibility to the verdict that the claim was not authentic.
